>> From: Kent Beck
>> I can't think of a simple way to make JUnit 4 work with Java 
>> 1.4, though.

--- "Cedric Beust" <cbeust@g...> wrote:
> It's not very hard:  TestNG supports both 1.4 and 1.5
> annotations by using QDox to parse 1.4 annotations:
> /** @... groups = "functional db" */
> public void insertIntoDataBase() { ... }
> equivalent to
> @Test(groups = { "functional", "db" })
> public void insertIntoDataBase() { ... }

I've been toying with an idea:

public static Annotation[] insertIntoDataBase = {new IsTest()};
public void insertIntoDataBase() { ... }

IE: The annotation is a static Field with the same name as the Method.

Annotating methods with parameters would require some creative name 
decoration.  And annotating Fields or classes could be interesting...

It's an idea.     ;->
